title.narrative: 3.4 - SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING & SAFE SCHOOLS

description.narrative: 3.4-The government has increased capacity to legislate, plan, budget and monitor to improve education programme, including mainstreaming DRR/CCA and SZOP with focus on improving children's safety and resilience

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Risk assessment and analysis (including conflict, disaster, climate, epidemics)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.4-The government has increased capacity to legislate, plan, budget and monitor to improve education programme, including mainstreaming DRR/CCA and SZOP with focus on improving children’s safety and resilience

description.narrative: Mid-term review of SSDP completed, program results framework updated based on mid-term review and the transition plan. 40 Municipalities selected by government for equity focus interventions based on severity of education disparities; additional resources allocated for implementation of equity strategy plan in 40 Municipalities. Comprehensive School Safety minimum package, implementation guideline, communication and dissemination strategy endorsed by government.UNICEF and partners supported 168 local governments to disseminate the CSS Minimum Package in 7,471 schools in 23 vulnerable districts ensuring its operationalization for school resilience. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of community schools using their EMIS generated school profile for planning and SIP budgeting
Number of local Governments with comprehensive education sector plans that are based on the integrated Child Friendly School model and include equity-based costed strategies

target.value: 2022:200 Local government (15 districts in old structure)

title.narrative: Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control) [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]
Number of schools/ communities developing and implementing disaster risk reduction measures/plans with UNICEF support
System Strengthening - Gender - National education sector plan/policies support gender-responsive environments - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Existence of national strategies to address inequities in education access, participation and retention - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
Percentage of public schools in UNICEF target provinces that are open as per the academic year

baseline.value: 70% of 175 project schools open at least 200 school days (this is 8 % schools of five districts

title.narrative: Percentage of targets of the School Sector Development Plan/Education Sector Programme Results Framework reached on an annual basis

baseline.value: SSDP result framework based on access, participation and learning outcome indicators approved

target.value: 2022:70% of yearly targets of SSDP results, framework met
